Rally and Demonstration against War and Bush Held
articles.content:
Rally and Demonstration against War and Bush Held 
    Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- A rally of civic and social organizations was held in Kyongju, North Kyongsang Province on Nov. 17 denouncing Bush's visit to south Korea, according to the south Korean KBS.
 The ralliers charged that the aim sought by Bush in his visit to south Korea is to realize at any cost the strategy for world supremacy in Northeast Asia including the Korean Peninsula.    
 They said that the "government" of south Korea is in active cooperation with the U.S. moves for a war of aggression, strongly demanding that the "government" immediately give up a plan for extending the deployment of its troops in Iraq and drop its hostile policy toward the north.
 At the end of the rally the participants waged a demonstration, shouting the slogans against war and Bush.

articles.title: International Peace Forum Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
International Peace Forum Held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- An "international peace forum for dismantlement of the U.S. military base and against war and neo-liberal 'globalization'" (Phyongthaek international peace forum) was held at Taechu Primary School in Phaengsong Township, Phyongthaek City, Kyonggi Province of south Korea on Nov. 16, according to a news report.
 Present there were representatives of south Korean civic and public organizations including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and foreign activists under the "Pan-Asian Joint Action Opposing the U.S. and Japanese Imperialists' Domination over and Aggression of Asia".
 Speakers at the forum said that they would fight to the end to check the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek for independence and peace on the Korean Peninsula.    
 A joint resolution of the Phyongthaek international forum was made public there.    
 It underscored the need to launch the intense struggle for the dismantlement of the U.S. military base in south Korea and other regions of Asia.
 Noting that the U.S. neo-liberalism offensive and the strategy for military hegemony are all one in essence, it called upon the Asian people to achieve solidarity to check it.

Cyprian President Supports Reunification of Korea
articles.content:
Cyprian President Supports Reunification of Korea
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- I support the Korean people in their cause to achieve the national reunification without the interference of foreign forces.
 Cyprian President Tassos Papadopoulos said this on Nov. 14 when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador to Cyprus.
 He noted that Cyprus and the DPRK have supported each other in UN and non-alignment movement because their territories are divided and the friendly relations are very close though they are geographically far away from each other.    
 Expressing his understanding on the stand of the DPRK government to defend the sovereignty of the country, he hoped that the two countries would support and cooperate with each other and strengthen the solidarity in the future, too.

articles.title: November Issue of Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Published
articles.content:
November Issue of Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Published
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China published the November issue of the magazine "Paektu-Halla".
 The magazine carried the photograph of leader Kim Jong Il on the tribune of honor during the military parade and mass demonstration celebrating the 55th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and a letter sent to him by the association on the occasion of the 60th founding anniversary of the WPK.    
 In an article titled "Leadership of General Kim Jong Il Is the Source of Might of the WPK" the magazine highly praised the guidance provided by Kim Jong Il to glorify the WPK as the eternal party of President Kim Il Sung and develop into a powerful guiding force of the Songun revolution.
 The magazine also carried revolutionary anecdotes including "Strength of the Great Brilliant Commander" and "Whenever with These People" and an article titled "Kim Hyong Gwon who glorified his passionate life" on the occasion of the centenary of birth of indomitable revolutionary fighter Kim Hyong Gwon.    
 Seen on the magazine was an article "The National Alliance for the Country's Reunification Greeting Its 15th Anniversary."
 The "News from North and South" columns of the magazine included an account of the 11th meeting of the North-South Committee for the Promotion of Economic Cooperation and other news of inter-Korean exchange and cooperation.

articles.title: Demonstration against Bush's Visit to S. Korea
articles.content:
Demonstration against Bush's Visit to S. Korea
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Students under the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils launched a surprise demonstration against warmonger Bush's visit to south Korea in front of the Namdaemun in the Central District of Seoul on Nov. 16, according to the south Korean CBS.
 They shouted slogans such as "No warmonger Bush's visit to south Korea," carrying placards "Opposition to south Korea-U.S. summit talks" and "Destroy the ruinous south Korea-U.S. alliance."    
  It is said that police took away all the demonstrators that day.

articles.title: Greetings to Latvian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Latvian President
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Latvian President Vaira Vikeï¿½|Freiberga on the occasion of the national day of Latvia.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably, the message sincerely wished her greater successes in her responsible work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Police Suppression under Fire
articles.content:
Police Suppression under Fire
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A "joint press conference of the farmers, civic, public and religious organizations to denounce the suppression of the national farmers' meeting" was held in Seoul under the sponsorship of the "emergency measure committee to check the passage of the bill on rice negotiations through 'National Assembly'" on Nov. 16, according to a news report.
 Speakers at the press conference charged that 55 of the participants in the "national farmers' meeting" were taken away, 110 may lose their eyesight and more than 500 were wounded due to the Nov. 15 cruel suppression by the riot police. This is the extremely murderous act, they stressed.
 The press release read at the press conference noted that the Youido Park on Nov. 15 was the scene of the Kwangju incident in May 1980.
 We can no longer pardon the government which does not regard the farmers as its people, it said, stressing:    
 If the "National Assembly" railroads the bill, it will meet a protest stronger than that of the day.

articles.title: 60th Anniversary of People's Security Organ Marked
articles.content:
60th Anniversary of People's Security Organ Marked
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A meeting to commemorate the 60th founding anniversary of the people's security organ was held at the Ponghwa Art Theatre Friday.
 Minister of People's Security Ju Sang Song in his report noted that the 60 year-long course covered by the people's security organ is a glorious history in which the organ has developed into a guard force of the party and the leader and a worthwhile history in which it has successfully fulfilled its honorable mission and duty of protecting the security of the socialist system and the people's lives and properties.    
  President Kim Il Sung all his revolutionary life provided outstanding guidance and showed deep loving care and trust in the people's security persons and led them with great attention to fulfill the noble mission and duty as political defenders of the party, he said, and went on:
 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, attaching great importance to strengthening the people's security organ in every way along  with the People's Army, has deepened and developed the Juche-oriented idea and line of building the people's security organ and wisely led the people's security organ to be ranks fully equipped with a revolutionary view on the leader, the view on devotedly defending the headquarters of the revolution.    
 Kim Jong Il paid deep attention to the work to further strengthen and develop the people's security organ into one for revolutionary dictatorship boundlessly faithful to the idea and guidance of the party and the leader. He, at the same time, has led the organ to provide a sure guarantee for the implementation of the economic policy of the party and decisively frustrate the reactionary ideological and cultural poisoning by the class enemies, thereby making sure that the single-minded unity of the DPRK was consolidated in every way and the gains of socialism were firmly defended.
 The reporter called upon all the people's security persons to devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution under the uplifted banner of Songun and bring about a fresh turn in the work for people's security and reliably defend the general advance of the Songun revolution.

Protest Actions against Bush's S. Korea Visit Go on
articles.content:
Protest Actions against Bush's S. Korea Visit Go on
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The Seoul District Federation of University Student Councils (Sochongryon) under the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils and the Pusan Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration separately issued statements in denunciation of Bush's south Korea visit on Nov. 16 and 17, according to a press report.
 Sochongryon in its statement termed Bush's visit to south Korea part of the U.S. persistent moves for a war on the Korean Peninsula.
 The aim of the "south Korea-U.S. summit talks" this time is to further strengthen the humiliating "south Korea-U.S. alliance" and stoke the atmosphere of war in south Korea, it said.    
 The youths and students will clearly show arrogant Bush the will of the Korean nation for peace against war, the statement warned.
 The Pusan solidarity in its statement said that Bush seeks to strengthen "south Korea-U.S. alliance" and force south Korea to extend the term of its troops' presence in Iraq and cooperate in the efforts to realize the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. forces in south Korea at the "south Korea-U.S. summit talks."
 Meanwhile, the Women's Action against Bush called a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 15 in protest against Bush's visit to south Korea.
 A women's declaration signed by at least 60 women's organizations was read out at the press conference. It branded Bush as a warmonger who disturbs the life of the world people and threatens peace, noting that women's organizations would hold a women's conference in Pusan in protest against Bush's visit to south Korea.    
 Members of women's organizations called press conferences in Pusan and Jinju, South Kyongsang Province, on the same day to denounce Bush's visit.

North Side Organizing Committee Formed for Association of Men of National Literature
articles.content:
North Side Organizing Committee Formed for Association of Men of National Literature
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The north side organizing committee for the Association of Men of National Literature in the Era of June 15 was formed on Nov. 19 against the backdrop of the growing enthusiasm of the writers and other men of literature at home and overseas to implement the June 15 joint declaration.
 The north side organizing committee has Kim Tok Chol, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Writers Union, as its chairman, two vice-chairmen and five members.    
 The committee will energetically push ahead with the preparations for creating the association as early as possible in firm solidarity with the bodies of writers and other men of literature in the south and overseas.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Sok Ji Min
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Sok Ji Min
    Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il today sent a wreath to the bier of the late Sok Ji Min, people's actor of the State Merited Chorus of the KPA, expressing deep condolences over his death.
